intro: Ruehssia cundurango, commonly known as the Cundurango plant, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
